titleStmt.title: Thomas McIntosh to Thomas E. Bramlette

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
Bedford Trimble Co
Kentucky
Oct 6th 1863
To His Excellency
Thos. E. Bramlette, Governor of the Commonwealth of Kentucky.

Your petitioner Thos McIntosh would respectfully represent that at the October term of the Circuit Court of this county now being held, he was fined the sum of Ten Dollars & costs, for defending himself against one James M. Robert, having ^been^ necesserily ^been^ bound to strike him, but inflicting no serious injury. Now therefore I pray you in consideration of the justifying circumstances of the case, and my deciptitude, and advanced age being about 70 years of age, to remit said fine; and as is duty bound will ever pray & c & c --
We the undersigned citizens of Trimble Co Kentucky join the above petitioner in his prayer &c.

J. H. Lane
J R Lane
Jno Mullibine
J. H. Carracao
Jas Miller
C W Avnoto
E Wilhart
S Electum
M A Roberts
A M King
John J Morgan
R G Anderson
L. F. Hopwood one of the Jury turn sympathe

vs

Breach peace

10th Nov/ 63
